title: Use uploaded download.webp as Home hero background

requirements.summary: Add download.webp as a frontend static asset served directly by the frontend build.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository includes the image file "download.webp" in a public/static assets location that is served by the frontend build.
The image can be loaded in the browser via a stable URL path (no backend calls required).

file_operations.description: Add the provided image file to the frontend public assets so it is served statically at runtime (expected stable URL path: /assets/download.webp).

requirements.summary: Set download.webp as the Home page hero section background with a readability overlay and responsive cover sizing.
acceptanceCriteria: On route "/", the hero section renders with "download.webp" as its background image.
Hero heading, paragraph text, and CTA buttons remain readable on top of the background (e.g., via a semi-transparent overlay/gradient).
The background scales/crops responsively (no obvious stretching) across mobile and desktop viewports.

file_operations.description: Update only the Home hero section (the first section in this file) to use the static asset at /assets/download.webp as a CSS background image (cover/center/no-repeat), add a semi-transparent overlay/gradient layer to preserve text/button readability, and ensure content remains above the overlay via stacking context. Keep all other sections and other routes unchanged.
